paragraphs.content: Chapter 22
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 22

paragraphs.content: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

paragraphs.content: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?

paragraphs.content: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?

paragraphs.content: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?

paragraphs.content: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?

paragraphs.content: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

paragraphs.content: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

paragraphs.content: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;

paragraphs.content: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.

paragraphs.content: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!

paragraphs.content: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?

paragraphs.content: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

paragraphs.content: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?

paragraphs.content: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:

paragraphs.content: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?

paragraphs.content: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

paragraphs.content: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.

paragraphs.content: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.

paragraphs.content: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

paragraphs.content: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.

paragraphs.content: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.

paragraphs.content: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.

paragraphs.content: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.

paragraphs.content: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.

paragraphs.content: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.

paragraphs.content: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
